description_txt: stated on December 26, 2013 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "Nine out of the 10 poorest states are Red states."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • March 28, 2014

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2014 in a broadcast of "The Ed Show":
quote_txt: Health insurance and medical costs "are going down because of Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2014 in a Florida House subcommittee meeting:
quote_txt: "We have been teaching these (Common Core) standards in Florida schools since 2010."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2014 in an email blast:
quote_txt: "Kesha Rogers is not a Democrat."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2014 in press release:
quote_txt: Georgia has recovered more than $60 million that was lost to Medicaid fraud

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2014 in a campaign email to supporters:
quote_txt: Says Sen. Mitch McConnell is "the No. 1 recipient of contributions from lobbyists this cycle."

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2014 in his campaign website:
quote_txt: "Rick Scott tried to slash school funding by $3.3 billion."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2014 in a meeting with Republicans in Portsmouth, N.H.:
quote_txt: "I was the most bipartisan senator in the United States Senate."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2014 in an op-ed supporting Senate candidate Chris McDaniel:
quote_txt: Says Sen. Thad Cochran "voted to spend hundreds of millions of dollars on ... the Bridge to Nowhere in Alaska instead of shifting the money to repair a bridge damaged by Hurricane Katrina."

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2014 in an interview on MSNBC's "Jansing & Co.":
quote_txt: "Women take birth control, more than half of them, as a medication for other conditions."

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2014 in a broadcast of NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Most of the people who have signed up through the Obamacare exchanges "already had insurance."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2014 in a speech in Orlando:
quote_txt: "Our high school graduation rate is the highest on record."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2014 in public remarks:
quote_txt: "There are over 100 pipelines between the United States and Canada right now."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2014 in public remarks:
quote_txt: Florida's revenue "is growing at a faster rate than almost any state in the country."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2014 in a video:
quote_txt: "A child born in America today will inherit $1.5 million in debt the moment they're placed in their mother's arms."

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2014 in a post from Being Liberal:
quote_txt: Says Marco Rubio believes the earth is 9,000 years old and that humans hunted dinosaurs to extinction; says  Rand Paul believes the earth is 10,000 years old and God removed dinosaurs "to make space for humans."

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2014 in a video to supporters:
quote_txt: "Americans increasingly want (the Affordable Care Act) to be repealed."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2014 in a television ad from Let's Get to Work:
quote_txt: "Obamacare will drive 2.5 million Americans out of the workforce."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2014 in a television ad from Let's Get to Work:
quote_txt: Because of the federal health care law, "300,000 health plans canceled" in Florida.

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2014 in a meme on the Internet:
quote_txt: The percentage of black children born without a father in the home has risen from 7 percent in 1964 to 73 percent today, due to changes from President Lyndon Johnson’s Great Society.

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2014 in Atlanta press conference:
quote_txt: Says some Georgians can get health insurance for $105 a month.

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2014 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says he "forced Washington to open up the Arctic Ocean to oil drilling."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2014 in an oped column in the Austin American-Statesman:
quote_txt: On HealthCare.Gov, Texan Mark Sullivan "found a good" health insurance "plan that includes dental, for less than $80 a month."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2014 in an interview on "The Daily Show":
quote_txt: "Medicare has spent $172 million on penis pumps in the last five years at $360 a pop."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2014 in a letter to supporters:
quote_txt: For educational testing, Florida "has chosen a company that has a significant history of promoting identification of the GLBT lifestyle for children as young as seven years old."

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2014 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "Every 20 seconds, a child dies because they lack access to clean water and sanitation."

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2014 in comments on CBS' "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: The United States stopped plans to build a missile defense shield in Eastern Europe "as a gift to Russia."

description_txt: stated on January 21, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Our state economic development agency under Walker, WEDC, actually isn’t even using the funds that are appropriated to it."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2014 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: After hiring a campaign manager in 2006, "I got this $100 and something fee ... for hazardous materials."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2014 in a Facebook post.:
quote_txt: In Virginia’s Medicaid program, "approximately 30 percent, or $2.7 billion a year, is lost to waste, fraud and inefficiencies."
